title: Freak accident in San Francisco traps pedestrian under robotaxi
description: In a gruesome crash, a car struck a pedestrian in San Francisco and then tossed them in front of a Cruise driverless vehicle. The pedestrian was trapped for several minutes.

title: Appeals court limits cyber defense agency’s contacts with tech companies
description: The 5th Circuit decision, which bars CISA from encouraging tech companies to remove posts, could have sweeping implications for government efforts to secure the 2024 vote.

title: An emergency alert will hit phones Wednesday. Here’s what to expect.
description: Don’t be alarmed by the emergency phone, radio and TV warnings. They are a FEMA and FCC test of the national alert systems. Here’s what to expect.

title: ‘Influencer’ is a dirty word. It shouldn’t be.
description: Maybe you think people who post on social media professionally are silly attention hogs. But influencers can teach us the value of forging a sense of belonging.

title: Zoom is releasing its own version of Google Docs
description: Zoom says its collaborative documents app, rivaling Microsoft Word and Google Docs, will integrate with meetings and be generally available next year.

title: Space junk crackdown intensifies as FCC gives first-ever fine to Dish
description: The Federal Communications Commission fined Dish Network $150,000 for disposing of a satellite at an orbit “well below the elevation required by ... its license.”

title: ChatGPT provided better customer service than his staff. He fired them.
description: Artificial intelligence chatbots will upend how call centers and customer service hotlines operate. Countries like India and the Philippines are worried.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried’s trial is about to start. Here are 10 key figures.
description: A guide to ten of the key figures in the criminal trial of disgraced crypto kingpin Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Overwhelmed trying to protect your privacy? A new app does it for you.
description: Americans finally have some privacy rights. Permission Slip makes telling companies to delete or not sell your data simple. Really.

title: NASA got its first asteroid sample — with help from Queen guitarist Brian May
description: Before he was a rock star, Queen’s lead guitarist Brian May was an astrophysicist. He put those skills to the test in NASA’s first-ever asteroid sample return mission.
